{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559604,"name":"Hitendra Bedacie","username":"HitendraBedacie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T19:17:57.988Z","cooked":"

Hello From Team 564

Recently during the Finger Lakes Reigonal, we tried to Log our matches during our Quals and the Pose presented by our logger isnt accurate to our pose pasted on our Elastic Dashboard . An example could be seen here, our pose in our log spins repeatedly We are Stumped and would love some assistance.
our Code Repository
Our
rio_2025-03-17_14-59-31.zip (3.5 MB)

Did you set the “Rotation Units” in AdvantageScope to degrees instead of radians? You can change the units by right-clicking on the field under “Poses” and selecting “Rotation Units”. AdvantageScope uses radians by default, and mixing up units is a common issue that can cause the robot to rapidly spin in the visualization.

Unfortunately CTRE’s logger is currently using the legacy numeric array format for poses, which does not include a mechanism to automatically prevent unit conflicts like this (see the linked page for details).

Yup That was it, Thanks for the quick fix
